tenders.title: Supply of Kitchen Supplies - Cooking Oil, salt, wheat flour etc.
tenders.description: Provision of kitchen supplies including cooking oil for the academic year 2025-2026.

details.scope: Supply of cooking oil, salt, wheat flour, and other kitchen essentials for one academic year
details.deliverySchedule: Monthly deliveries as per school calendar
specifications: Cooking oil: Must be sealed, branded, and from registered manufacturers
Salt: Packaged iodized salt with KEBs certification
Wheat flour: Fortified with required vitamins and minerals
All products must have at least 6 months shelf life at delivery
submissionRequirements: Original and copy of bid document

tenders.title: Supply of Dry Cereals - Maize, Beans, Sorghum etc.
tenders.description: Provision of dry cereals including maize, beans, and sorghum for the academic year 2025-2026.

details.scope: Supply of maize, beans, sorghum, and other dry cereals for school feeding program
specifications: Maize: Grade 1, moisture content not exceeding 13%
Beans: Clean, sorted, with minimum foreign matter
Sorghum: Grade 1, properly cleaned and packaged
All cereals must be free from pests and contamination

tenders.title: Supply of Firewood
tenders.description: Supply of firewood for the academic year 2025-2026.

details.scope: Regular supply of quality firewood for school kitchen
specifications: Dry, well-seasoned firewood
Preferred wood types: hardwood species
Properly split and sized for school stoves
Moisture content not exceeding 20%

tenders.title: Supply of Insurance Cover
tenders.description: Provision of comprehensive insurance cover for the institution.

details.scope: Comprehensive insurance cover for school property, vehicles, and liability
specifications: Property insurance: Buildings, equipment, furniture
Motor vehicle insurance: School buses and vehicles
Public liability insurance
Fidelity guarantee for staff

tenders.title: Supply of Laboratory Equipment
tenders.description: Provision of laboratory equipment including chemistry, biology, and physics tools for the academic year 2025-2026.

details.scope: Supply of science laboratory equipment for Chemistry, Biology, and Physics departments
specifications: Chemistry: Glassware, chemicals, safety equipment
Biology: Microscopes, specimens, dissection kits
Physics: Measuring instruments, electrical equipment
All equipment must meet KNEC standards

tenders.title: Supply of Stationery
tenders.description: Provision of office and educational stationery for the academic year 2025-2026.

details.scope: Supply of office and educational stationery for entire school
specifications: Exercise books: Various sizes and page counts
Writing materials: Pens, pencils, markers
Office supplies: Files, folders, envelopes
Art materials: Drawing papers, colors

processSteps.title: Tender Advertisement
processSteps.description: All our tenders are advertised on this website, our social media and our notice board.

processSteps.title: Purchase of Tender Documents
processSteps.description: Interested bidders can purchase tender documents by paying the prescribed fee.

processSteps.title: Tender Preparation
processSteps.description: Bidders prepare their bids according to the specifications and requirements outlined in the tender documents.

processSteps.title: Bid Submission
processSteps.description: Completed bids should be submitted in sealed envelopes by the specified deadline.

processSteps.title: Tender Opening
processSteps.description: All bids are opened publicly on the specified date and time.

processSteps.title: Evaluation
processSteps.description: Bids are evaluated based on technical specifications, pricing, supplier qualifications, and other criteria.

processSteps.title: Award
processSteps.description: The tender is awarded to the most qualified bidder who meets all requirements.

processSteps.title: Contract Signing
processSteps.description: A formal contract is signed with the successful bidder.

requiredDocuments: Proof of Relevant Experience and References

faqs.question: How do I purchase tender documents?
faqs.answer: Tender documents can be purchased from the school's procurement office during working hours (Mon–Fri, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM). Payment is via the official bank account and a receipt must be presented. You can also download forms online and pay during submission.

faqs.question: Is the tender fee refundable?
faqs.answer: No. Tender fees are strictly non-refundable. They cover administrative and evaluation costs.

faqs.question: How are winning bids selected?
faqs.answer: We evaluate bids based on technical compliance, price, supplier capability, previous performance, and financial stability. Details are in each tender's documentation.

faqs.question: Can I submit a bid for multiple tenders?
faqs.answer: Yes. You may apply for multiple tenders if you meet each one's criteria. Each tender must be submitted separately with its own payment and documents.

faqs.question: Where can I get updates on new tenders?
faqs.answer: All tenders are published on our website's Tender section. You can also follow our social media or sign up for our email alerts for real-time notifications.

faqs.question: What happens if I miss the submission deadline?
faqs.answer: Late submissions are not accepted under any circumstances. Bids received after the deadline will be returned unopened.
